lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/JoJo.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run JoJo.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

* Represents a command to add a new Deadline task.

* displaying a success message, and saving the updated list to storage.

* Checks if this command is equal to another object.
* Two AddDeadlineCommands are equal if they have the same description and date.
* @param obj The object to compare with.
* @return True if the objects are equal, false otherwise.

* Checks if this command is equal to another object.
* Two AddEventCommands are equal if they have the same description, start time, and end time.
* @param obj The object to compare with.
* @return True if the objects are equal, false otherwise.
* Represents a command to add a new Todo task.
* Creates a command to add a Todo task.
* @param description The description of the todo.
* Executes the command by adding the Todo task to the task list,
* displaying a success message, and saving the updated list.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Represents an abstract command that can be executed.
* @param tasks   The list of tasks to operate on.
* @param ui      The UI to interact with the user.
* @param storage The storage to save/load data.
* @throws JoJoException If an error occurs during execution.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws JoJoException;
* Checks if this command terminates the application.
* @return true if the command is an exit command, false otherwise.
* Creates a command to delete the task at the specified index.
* @param index The zero-based index of the task to delete.
* Executes the command by removing the task, showing a message, and saving.
* @throws JoJoException If the index is invalid.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws JoJoException {
System.out.println(" Noted. I've removed this task:");
System.out.println(" Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Represents a command to exit the application.

public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {

* Represents a command to mark a task as done.
* Creates a command to mark the task at the specified index.
* @param index The zero-based index of the task.
* Executes the command by marking the task as done and saving the list.
* @throws JoJoException If the index is invalid.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws JoJoException {
System.out.println(" Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n   " + tasks.get(index));
* Represents a command to mark a previously completed task as not done.
* Creates a command to unmark the task at the specified index.
* @param index The zero-based index of the task to unmark.
* Executes the command by marking the task as not done,
* displaying a confirmation message, and saving the updated list.
* @throws JoJoException If the index provided is invalid.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws JoJoException {
System.out.println(" OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n   " + tasks.get(index));
* Represents exceptions specific to the JoJo application.
